item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Lothy:

Seeing as the discussion has been revived, I may as well throw in my 2 cents. I wouldn’t consider myself religious by any stretch of the word. However I’d never go to lengths to disprove something that so many people have an unshakable belief in.

So if there are parts of the country where religion is taught over science, that’s okay because it’s what the teachers/parents believe in?

Read full topic

R.I.P RSC:

Alex, there is no such thing as karma. Do you really think that without karma, you won’t go to prison after you break into a house?

I’m not disproving it. Just think that thats a good answer why it took soo long to get caught.

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

No, I am not a religious person at all, I’m not going to sit here and bore you with my theories (Yes, I have theories, I know it really wouldn’t seem like it huh?) but simply the fact that there really is no god, theres no sense why if there was a god, why wouldn’t there be proof of this? I know theres no proof that theres not a god, but I am not religious for I believe there isn’t anything greater than a human being (Not saying I don’t believe in aliens but thats a different subject.). I believe in Karma because I know its real after I broke into 3 houses and got sent to jail for 4.5 months, the worst time of my life. While I was in there, I had time to think, I prayed and nothing happened, I believed in god for 3 months I was in there, nothing happened that I wanted to happen, nothing. Still was in that bitch, still was eating shit everyday, still people started fights and riots. I went to church in there as much as possible, all they would really tell me if I believe and pray things will work out, but it never did. I stopped believing weeks before my court date, and I still got out on my court date. This may not be a good reason to believe in religion or not. I think it is… Whenever I get asked, I tell them I have no religion, because religion is just based on belief and money, do you really think that Christianity would be around if there was no money to be made it in? This world runs on money and thats another reasons why I don’t believe in it.

But all in all, I still say God Damn, Why me God? Etc, just was born and raised that way, doesn’t mean I actually believe in a god :P.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

I, myself, am not religious. I follow the Protestant faith; but I don’t get all bible crazy over it and every single person. That’s just ridiculous to overdo how you worship, and it’s even more ridiculous to try to convert someone to your faith when they are content with they religion they are in.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:79, topic:239”]History that was based on facts and stories of centuries ago.
We do not know everything of our past life, hence we cannot be more conclusive about our past as we are about our current.[/quote]

Which is where science comes in, and proves the stories wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”]I’ve got a question for the christians here, what are your opinions on this video?

GodTube

A Letter From Hell

A Letter From Hell A Christian Story...

I ask because this is shown to children, do any of you think this is fucking sick and disgusting?[/quote]
I couldn’t stop laughing because of the “Silk” soy milk ads on the bottom and it’s offer of a “weekend getaway”.
I didn’t finish the video but from what I saw of it I agree, that’s fucking disgusting.
[I’m am an atheist though not a christian]

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

akl:

Who are you to speak about our childhood since you did not exist when we did not know about germs or could account for earthquakes…

Just because I wasnt alive during the bronze age doesnt meant I’m totally ignorant of it. Theres this little thing called history and its very useful.

btw, I should make it clear that those are not my words, I’m quoting Christopher Hitchens.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:72, topic:239”]Religious faith belongs to the sinister, spoiled, selfish childhood of our species. Of course, a five-year-old with an imaginary friend is cute. A twenty-five year old with an imaginary friend is just disturbing. Put simply, it’s time to grow up, and put away these childish things.

It belongs to the terrified childhood of our species, before we knew about germs or could account for earthquakes. It belongs to our childhood, too, in the less charming sense of demanding a tyrannical authority: a protective parent who demands compulsory love even as he exacts a tithe of fear.[/quote]
This wraps up my thoughts exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @zol zol
item.description:
@zol wrote:

Absolutely not religious.

Is God willing to prevent evil, but not able? Then he is not omnipotent. Is he able, but not willing? Then he is malevolent. Is he both able and willing? Then whence cometh evil? Is he neither able nor willing? Then why call him God?

Read full topic

item.title: Are you religious or not?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

I was born a catholic. But it doesn’t sound very real to me. I was talking to a priest at my church a few weeks ago. He told me he tells the people that go to church that they’re soul will go to heaven. YOU don’t go to heaven. So I think what teachers in schools are teaching their students is a little over exaggerated. I spoke to my religion teacher about what the priest told me. And my teacher thought I was crazy, he was denying everything. He was nervous when I asked him these questions as well.

Read full topic

I think that as long as you do what you want and it does not harm anyone, do it.

item.title: Are you religious or not?

item.description:

r0ckstar96:

Then tell me something, where do you think your soul will go after you die? Has to go somewhere, heaven or hell, and atheists don’t believe in that so where are you gonna go? To life eternal in heaven, or life eternal in a smelly ass place where you’re a slave…

It doesn’t go anywhere, you don’t have a “soul.” You will not be aware when you are dead, you will just be gone, and rotting in the dirt.
You don’t understand atheism.
